CWEs: CWE-676: Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
description: The function uses 'Buffer.allocUnsafe' to allocate buffer space. This method of buffer allocation can lead to vulnerabilities as it allows for the creation of a Buffer instance with uninitialized memory. This uninitialized memory could potentially contain sensitive data. It is recommended to use 'Buffer.alloc' instead, which will initialize the buffer with zeroes.
